intro: Justicia alboreticulata, commonly known as the white-veined jewelweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a distinctive white or pale green veining pattern. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
